isis.stitle: TRW MANUAL STEERING GEAR - ASSEMBLE - ROLLERSHAFT, SHAFT COVER AND HOUSING ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: ROLLERSHAFT, SHAFT COVER AND HOUSING ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Insert adjusting screw into shaft cover from the bearing side of cover and draw rollershaft into the bearing until the shaft bottoms in the shaft cover, then reverse adjusting screw rotation one full turn.
Position new gasket on shaft cover and insert the output shaft assembly with gasket and cover into housing and into mesh with worm. Align housing, gasket and cover bolt holes.

To align a shaft cover that does not require alignment dowels, first assemble two shaft cover bolts with flat washers under the bolt heads, one in the top and bottom of the cover. Tighten the bolts snugly [3 to 5 ft-lbs. (4 to 7 Nm)]. Carefully assemble new shaft seal. Alternately rotate the INPUT SHAFT to 1/4 revolution from each end of travel. Lash must be present in each position. An OUTPUT SHAFT torque of 6 in-lbs. (0.7 Nm) or less must rotate the output shaft when in the lash positions with no perceptible binding. If a no-lash (a binding) condition exists at either or both of the stated lash positions, return the output shaft to center of travel position. Tap the edge of the shaft cover with a mallet to move the cover up or down, left or right. Then repeat the alignment checking procedure. Repeat the cover tapping and alignment check procedures until alignment is achieved. Then tighten the two cover bolts already in the assembly to approximately the final torque specification. Assemble the other cover bolts and tighten them to 45 to 55 ft-lbs. (61 to 75 Nm). Remove the two bolts that have the washers and reassemble them without the washers and tighten to 45 to 55 ft-lbs. (61 to 75 Nm). Again check the lash conditions.

To align a reassembled shaft cover that requires alignment dowels, assemble all cover bolts and tighten finger tight. Install both dowels and drive dowels in for shaft cover alignment until 1/4 of each dowel is above the cover dowel boss. Tighten cover bolts to 45 to 55 ft-lbs. (61 to 75 Nm). Drive in both dowels flush with shaft cover. If the dowel fit is loose, reference procedure for installing oversize dowels per REPAIR.

To install a new shaft cover that requires alignment dowels, follow Step 3 for aligning a shaft cover without dowels. When the cover bolts are tightened to specified final torque, and the proper alignment is achieved, ream through housing and shaft cover per REPAIR, and install the appropriate size dowels.
Carefully press in new rollershaft seal.
Assemble O-ring and adjusting screw locknut.
Follow the OUTPUT ROLLERSHAFT OR TOTAL MESH.
Fill gear housing to the proper lube level with the recommended lubricant. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
